channel.title: Speed Limit on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Speed Limit on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: I-70 East - Speed Reduced to 75 MPH
item.description: I-70 East - Speed reduced to 75 MPH ahead. Approaching the Utah-Colorado State Line. The Speed Limit on I-70 in Utah is 80 MPH.

item.title: I-29 North - Speed Limit 70/Minimum 40
item.description: I-29 North - Speed Limit 70/Minimum 40

item.title: IA-31 South - Correctionville
item.description: Entering Correctionville on IA-31 South. Speed Limit 45 MPH.

item.title: IA-31 South - Quimby
item.description: Entering Quimby on IA-31 south. Speed Limit 45 MPH.

item.title: US-59 South - Primghar
item.description: Entering Primghar on US-59 South. Speed Limit 45 MPH.

item.title: CA-266 North - Mono County
item.description: CA-266 north in Mono County. Speed Limit 65 MPH.

item.title: US-95 South - Oregon Thanks You
item.description: US-95 South - Oregon Thanks You - Come Back Soon. Speed 25 MPH, approaching the Oregon-Nevada state line.

item.title: ID-33 East - Sugar City
item.description: Entering Sugar City on ID-33 East. Speed Limit 35.

item.title: ID-81 South - Malta
item.description: Entering Malta on ID-81 south. Speed Limit 45 MPH.

item.title: ID-78 West - Murphy
item.description: Entering Murphy (unincorporated) on ID-78 west. Murphy is the county seat of Owyhee County.

item.title: I-80 East - Exits 120 and 121
item.description: I-80 east approaching Exit 120 - I-15 North/Ogden. Also approaching Exit 121 - 600 South. Use left lanes for I-80 East and I-15 South. Speed Limit 65 MPH / Truck Speed 55 MPH.

item.title: I-80 East - Speed Limit 75
item.description: Speed Limit 75 / Minimum Speed 40 on I-80 east in Deuel County.

item.title: US-26 East - Morrill
item.description: US-26 East (incorrectly signed as NE-26) in Morrill. Speed Limit 25 MPH.

item.title: US-26 East - Alpine
item.description: US-26 east at the Wyoming-Idaho state line. Speed Limit 65 MPH.

item.title: ID-81 North - Declo
item.description: Entering Declo - Population 343 on ID-81 North. Speed Limit 45 MPH. Milepost 26.

item.title: US-30 West - Twin Falls
item.description: Entering Twin Falls on US-30 west. Twin Falls is the 8th largest city in Idaho (2010 Census) and the county seat of Twin Falls County. Speed Limit 35 MPH.

item.title: ID-24 East - Rupert
item.description: Entering Rupert on ID-24 south. Speed Limit 35 MPH. Rupert is the county seat of Minidoka County.

item.title: ID-78 West - Hammett
item.description: Entering Hammett on ID-78 west. Speed Limit 35 MPH.

item.title: I-15 North - Speed Limit 80
item.description: Speed Limit 80 MPH on I-15 north. This is the starting of the 80 MPH zone northbound in Utah.

item.title: WY-150 South - Speed Limit 70 MPH
item.description: Speed Limit 70 MPH on WY-150 South

item.title: US-93 Alt South - Speed Limit 70 MPH
item.description: Speed limit 70 MPH on Alt. US-93 South leaving West Wendover. Distance marker to Jct. US-93 and Ely.

item.title: I-10 West - Exit 239
item.description: I-10 west approaching Exit 239 - Louisa Ave. Trucks Use Right Lane - Maintain Speed. Speed Limit 60.

item.title: AL-135 North - Speed Limit 26
item.description: Speed Limit 26 on AL-135 North - Gulf State Park.

item.title: ID-19 West - Greenleaf
item.description: Entering Greenleaf on ID-19 west. Speed Limit 35 MPH.

item.title: BL-84 - Caldwell
item.description: BL-84 West in Caldwell on Blaine St. Speed Limit 35 MPH.

item.title: US-93 South/MT-200 East Approaching I-90
item.description: US-93 South/MT-200 East approaching I-90. Use I-90 west for Coeur d’Alene (Idaho); I-90 east for Missoula.

item.title: US-93 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-93 south. Distance to Ronan, Jct. MT-200, and Missoula. Speed Limit 55 MPH.

item.title: US-95 North - Eastport
item.description: Entering Eastport on US-95 north. Speed Limit 25 MPH.

item.title: US-2 West/US-97 South Approaching US-2/US-97 Split
item.description: US-2 West/US-97 South approaching US-2/US-97 Split. Use US-97 south for WA-970/I-90 to Cle Elum, Ellensburg, and Seattle. A variable speed limit sign shows the speed as 60 MPH.

item.title: OR-11 South - Welcome To Oregon
item.description: Welcome to Oregon on OR-11 south at the Washington-Oregon state line. Also the first speed limit sign in Oregon is in the background - 55 MPH. Most Oregon speed limit signs omit the word Limit.

item.title: BC-6 North - Speed Limit
item.description: Speed Limit 90 km/h on BC-6 North.

item.title: BC-21 North - Think Metric
item.description: Think Metric sign on BC-21 north, just past the Rykerts Port of Entry. 50 MPH = 80 km/h.

item.title: ID-1 North - Porthill
item.description: Entering Porthill on ID-1 north.

item.title: US-97 South - Speed Limit
item.description: Speed limit on US-97 south. Speed 60 MPH / 100 KmH. This is the only speed limit sign south of the border with dual measurement systems.

item.title: BC-3 East - Princeton City Centre
item.description: BC-3 East - Princeton City Centre 2nd left. Maximum 50 km/h.

item.title: BC-3 East - Maximum 80 km/h
item.description: BC-3 East - Maximum 80 km/h

item.title: Sea Island Way East Approaching BC-99
item.description: Sea Island Way East Approaching BC-99 in Richmond. Speed Limit 60 km/h.

item.title: BC-99 North - Exit 10
item.description: BC-99 north approaching Exit 10 - King George Blvd/Surrey City Center. Speed Limit - 100 km/h.

item.title: I-84 West - Variable Speed Limits
item.description: Variable Speed Limit sign on I-84 West, just outside of Baker City. The stretch of I-84 between Baker City and Ladd Canyon converted to variable speed limits in 2016.

item.title: US-95 North - Speed Limit
item.description: Speed Limit 70 MPH/Truck Speed 65 MPH on US-95 north - just north of the Nevada line. The state of Oregon recently raised the speed limit on the stretch of highway from 55 MPH to 70 MPH in the spring of 2016. Until then all non rural interstate highways in Oregon were limited at 55 MPH.

item.title: AK-8 West - State Speed Limit
item.description: AK-8 West (Denali Highway) - State Speed Limit 50 MPH. Denali Highway is closed durning the winter months. The first 20 miles from Paxson to Tangle Lakes are paved. The remaining 114 miles are gravel.

item.title: AK-1 North - Passing Lane Speeds
item.description: Passing lane with different speed per lane on AK-1 north between Turnagain Pass and Girdwood. There are a few passing lanes near Turnagain Pass that have a faster speed limit on the passing lane than in the right lane.

item.title: AK-9 North - Seward
item.description: First AK-9 shield northbound along 3rd Ave. in Seward. Speed limit 25 MPH.

item.title: I-15 North - Speed Limit 80
item.description: Speed Limit 80 / Trucks 65 on I-15 north. Montana raised their speed limits to 80 MPH on rural interstates on October 1st 2015.

item.title: ID-21 East - Entering Stanley
item.description: Entering Stanley on ID-21 East - Population 63. Speed Limit 35 MPH.

item.title: I-15 South - Speed Limit 80 MPH
item.description: Speed Limit 80 MPH on I-15 south, just south of the Idaho-Montana border. The speed limit along I-15 is 80 MPH to Idaho Falls.

item.title: US-87 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-87 south. Distance to Big Sandy and Great Falls. Truck Speed Limit - 60 MPH/Truck Night Speed Limit - 55 MPH.

item.title: MT-5 West - Speed Limit
item.description: Speed limit 70 MPH/Night Speed 65 MPH on MT-5 west.

item.title: US-191 North - Yellowstone Speed Limits
item.description: US-191 North - Speed Limit of 55 MPH in Yellowstone National Park. Most speed limits on Montana highways are 70 MPH.

item.title: ID-19 East - Greenleaf
item.description: Entering Greenleaf, Population 862 on ID-19 east.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West - Nyssa
item.description: US-20/US-26 West in Nyssa. This is the first US-20/US-26 shields westbound in Oregon. In the last few years, standard Speed Limit signs have been appearing in Oregon. Normally, Oregon Speed Limit signs omit the word limit, and have larger numbers.

item.title: I-84 East - Speed Limit 80
item.description: Speed Limit 80/Truck Speed 70 on I-84 east. Idaho raised the speed limits on most rural interstates from 75 to 80 in July 2014.

item.title: I-84 East - Speed Limit 80
item.description: Speed Limit 80 MPH on I-84 east. Truck speed limit 70 MPH. The speed limit in Idaho was raised in July 2014. Utah, Texas, and Wyoming also have speed limits this high.

item.title: US-56/US-64/US-412 East/US-385 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-56/US-64/US-412 East/US-385 North. Distance to Boise City and Guymon. Speed limit on this stretch of highway is 65 MPH.

item.title: US-87 South - Texline City Limit
item.description: Texline City Limit on US-87 south. Texline is right on the New Mexico - Texas line.

item.title: BL-84 West - Glenns Ferry
item.description: Speed limit 25 MPH on BL-84 west in Glenns Ferry.

item.title: BL-84 West - Entering Glenns Ferry
item.description: Entering Glenns Ferry, Idaho on BL-84 west - Population 1,611.

item.title: I-15 South - Speed Limit 80
item.description: Speed Limit 80 on I-15 south. Utah raised speed limits on sections of I-15 in 2008, and in 2012 decided to make these test sections permanent. Texas is the only other state with speed limits this high.

item.title: I-84 East - Speed Limit 75/Minimum Speed 45
item.description: Speed Limit 75/Minimum Speed 45 on I-84 east. Minimum speeds are not posted with every speed sign on Utah freeways, but are placed sporadically. A typical speed limit installation just contains the maximum speed.

item.title: Offramp for I-405 North to US-26 at 12th Ave.
item.description: Offramp from I-405 to US-26 west at 12th Ave. interchange. Stay in left lanes for US-26 West/Ocean Beaches/Beaverton. Speed limit is 50 MPH. This speed limit sign is one of the newer style speed limit signs seen on Oregon freeways, with the word LIMIT included.

item.title: I-25 South - Exit 242
item.description: I-25 south approaching Exit 242 - US-550 West/NM-165 East/Rio Rancho/Placitas. This is the southern end of US-550. The speed limit drops from 75 miles per hour to 70 miles per hour as the highway enters the edge of the Albuquerque metropolitan area.

item.title: US-160 East - Wildlife Zone
item.description: Wildlife Zone on US-160 east in Archueta County. Fines double for any speed violations in the Wildlife Zone between 5PM and 7AM September through May.

item.title: OR-11 South - Welcome To Oregon
item.description: Welcome to Oregon on OR-11 south at the Washington-Oregon state line. Also the first speed limit sign in Oregon is in the background - 55 MPH. Most Oregon speed limit signs omit the word Limit.

item.title: Moffat County 10N - Wyoming-Colorado State Line
item.description: Moffat County 10N at the Wyoming-Colorado State Line. The mile marker below the highway shield is a standard Wyoming mile marker, and is for WY-430.

item.title: CO-318 East
item.description: CO-318 east shield just east of the Utah-Colorado State Line.

item.title: I-10 East - Exit 20A
item.description: I-10 west at Exit 20A - New Mexico Information Center/Rest Area. Speed limit drops from 75 MPH to 65 MPH as I-10 enters Lordsburg.

item.title: ID-128 West - Lewiston
item.description: ID-128 west in Lewiston. ID-128 follows the north side of the Clearwater and Snake River, and connects with WA-128.

item.title: I-84 West - Speed 65
item.description: I-84, just west of Oregon-Idaho line - Speed 65. The top speed in Oregon is 65, 10 miles less than Idaho. Notice Oregon does not use the word limit in the speed limit signs.

item.title: ID-55 South - Owyhee County Line
item.description: ID-55 south at Snake River/Owyhee county line.

item.title: Entering Gooding - US-26 West
item.description: Entering Gooding on US-26 West

item.title: BC-99 South - Maximum 80 km/h
item.description: Speed Limit 80 km/h Sign on BC-99 South

item.title: BC-99 South - Maximum 90 km/h
item.description: Speed Limit 90 km/h Sign on TC-1 East/BC-99 South

item.title: TC-1 East - Maximum 50 km/h
item.description: Maximum 50 km/h at East End of Horseshoe Bay Ferry Terminal.

item.title: US-50 East - Nevada State Line
item.description: US-50 east at the California-Nevada state line.

item.title: BC-13 North - Think Metric
item.description: Think Metric Sign at USA-Canada Border on BC-13 North.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching Canadian Border - Laurier
item.description: US-395 North approaching the United States - Canada Border. The United States side is Port of Laurier; the Canadian side is Port of Cascade.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching United States - Canada Border
item.description: US-395 North approaching the United States - Canada Border. The United States side is Port of Laurier; the Canadian side is Port of Cascade.

item.title: US-730 West - Speed 55
item.description: US-730 West - Speed 55 in Umatilla County. This is a standard type of speed limit sign in Oregon, especially on two lane highways. The idea is that only the world Speed (and not limit) invokes the Oregon Basic Speed Law instead of a hard and fast limit.

item.title: Montana Speed Limits - Reasonable and Prudent
item.description: Old Montana Reasonable and Prudent Speed Limit Sign, MT-200 East

item.title: ID-66 South - Speed Limit
item.description: Idaho Speed Limit 55 Sign on ID-66 South
